result.execSummary:
The defendant David J. Meboe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions:  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any counseling or programming ordered by the agent.  Costs have been remitted by the Court.  1 day credit in the event of revocation.

With work release. Concurrent with 16CM88. *JOC AMENDED 6/16/17: HUBER REVOKED.
Concurrent with: 16CM88

records.addlTxt: 16CM88 and 16CM120/motion hrg on State's motion to revoke huber. Defendant David J. Meboe appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail. DA Harper appeared for the State. Court grants motion to revoke huber and directs the clerk to amend the JOC's accordingly.

State's Motion to Revoke Huber (forwarded to the Court for review)

6/12/17: Court's response to State's motion: "Please set for a hearing to consider the State's Motion." Clerk notes that said hearing has already been set for 6/16/17 at 1:30 p.m.
Motion hearing on June 16, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

DA Harper appears for the State; Def appears, in custody, with Atty. McDougal. Sentencing after revocation of probation in 16CM120/Count 1 and 16CM88/Count 1. Counsel ask the Court to adopt the agent's recommendation. Court orders sentence as follows:

Count 1/16CM88 - 9 months jail with work release and 56 days credit
Count 1/16CM120 - 4 months jail, concurrent, with work release
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 26, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for David J. Meboe
Current: 10421 County Hwy A, La Farge, WI 54639 United States  (Effective: 10-04-2016)
Prior: 214 W. Seminary, Richland Center, WI 53581

Defendant David J. Meboe in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together including 16CM99, 16CM120, 16CM119, 16CM118, and 16TR1272-1277.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution calling for def's pleas to count 1 in 16CM88 and count 1 in 16CM120 for proposed sentence of 18 months probation; all other charges and cases to be dismissed and read in.  Def pleads guilty to both counts stated.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence withheld for 18 months probation.  Conditions:  Attend, pay for, and succ. complete any counseling or programming ordered by agent; costs, to be taken as civil judgment if any remains at end.  1 day credit in 16CM120.  1 set of costs, to be applied in 16CM88 case.  Costs remitted in 16CM120.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 16, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Cases 16CM118, 16CM119 AND 16CM120 called together. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court with Defendant David J. Meboe who appeared via video from the RC jail. Atty Lisa McD asks for a set-over for an AIA. So ordered.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 16, 2016 at 02:00 pm.  Also, Atty Lisa McD asks that all cases for DM be set for this time, including 16CM88. So ordered.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 16, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
